title: Mandela Released from Prison
summary: On February 11, 1990, Nelson Mandela walked free from Victor Verster Prison in South Africa after 27 years of imprisonment for his anti-apartheid activism. His release, ordered by President F.W. de Klerk, marked the beginning of the end of apartheid. Four years later, Mandela won South Africa's first fully democratic election and became the nation's first Black president.
